question:
Select 5 people for a dinner party that will have the most engaging conversations.

People and their interests:
1. Mohammed: Cooking (level 6), Yoga (level 10), Meditation (level 14)
2. Umar: Sports (level 9), History (level 11), Meditation (level 6)
3. Liam: Fashion (level 4), Meditation (level 7), Cooking (level 3), Painting (level 2), History (level 12)
4. Kwame: Poetry (level 5), Fashion (level 12), Gardening (level 5), Yoga (level 1), Photography (level 6)
5. Oliver: History (level 10), Photography (level 8), Cooking (level 6)
6. Willow: Cooking (level 8), Gardening (level 10), Poetry (level 8), Art (level 1), Fashion (level 2)
7. Hana: Sports (level 7), History (level 19)
8. Kevin: Travel (level 9), Art (level 3), Fashion (level 13)
9. Bjorn: Photography (level 7), Yoga (level 2), History (level 7), Travel (level 7), Gardening (level 1)
10. Fatma: Sports (level 7), Art (level 17)
11. Fatima: History (level 2), Photography (level 5), Fashion (level 14), Cooking (level 1)
12. Ahmed: Photography (level 8), Painting (level 6), Fashion (level 4), Sports (level 4)
13. Rachel: Sports (level 6), Fashion (level 5), Poetry (level 5), Yoga (level 4)
14. Penelope: Meditation (level 3), Painting (level 6), Sports (level 9), Yoga (level 9)
15. Carlos: Photography (level 2), Poetry (level 25)
16. Elijah: Cooking (level 6), Art (level 5), Poetry (level 4), Yoga (level 15)
17. Lena: Poetry (level 2), Gardening (level 11), Art (level 10), History (level 7)
18. Alice: Travel (level 2), Painting (level 4), Cooking (level 24)
19. Viktor: Meditation (level 2), Art (level 5), Poetry (level 10), Sports (level 1), Yoga (level 12)
20. Guillermo: Poetry (level 3), Meditation (level 9), Fashion (level 4), Travel (level 4)

Please choose 5 people that would create the most engaging dinner party.

Scoring Explanation:
The game is split into 3 rounds. Each round is different, and provides a way for each participant in the dinner party to score points.
At the end of the game, each participant's points are added together to score the dinner party as a whole.

Here are the rules for each round:

Round 1: [Most Common Interest] First, find the most commonly shared interest by number of people with any value in the interest (breaking ties alphabetically), and make it the topic for the round. Then, award each person their value in that interest in points.

Round 2: [Loudest Interest] In this round, we find the interest with the highest value among all guests which has not yet been discussed. This is the highest single value in a single interest that one person has. Break ties alphabetically by interest name. Then, each person is awarded their value in that interest in points.

Round 3: [Focused Host] In this round, the host is chosen as the guest with the fewest number of interests (breaking ties alphabetically, and skipping guests who have previously hosted a round). Then, each guest gets 2 points for each interest they share with the host.


The final score is the sum of all interest levels for these top 3 interests.
In all cases, if there is a tie between valid options, it goes to the interest or person with the name closest to the beginning of the alphabet.
Your goal is to maximize the total score of the dinner party, by choosing just the right group of people.


Answer immediately with "Answer: <person1>, <person2>, ... Done."

scoring_guide.task_description: Select 5 people for a dinner party that will have the most engaging conversations.
